PKbqYjGjSgG6mtePfAN6hg.text: Pickled eggs. A bored looking teenager behind the counter. At least one very black chip. These are the things I've come to be accustomed to from a standard chip shop. Kerbisher and Malt has none of these. It's different yet feels familiar and I'd go as far as to say it may well be the best fish and chip shop I've experienced. Three weeks after eating there, we're still raving about it. Obviously take away is an option, but it's worth taking time to eat in the clean, minimalist nautical-themed cafe area, if only to whet your appetite with the dishes coming out of the kitchen. The fish is among some of the freshest I've ever tasted from a chippy - and I used to frequent Westcountry fishing towns a lot - and is offered in a batter, special light breadcrumbs or grilled. Having tried both of the latter, I'd be seriously tempted to go for the grilled option every time. As for the extras, the chips are neither too thick or too stingy, and have a pleasing texture. Most importantly, the mushy peas are spot on. Equally impressive are the list of specials and sides. Just to check it wasn't just the basics, we ordered a delicious fennel salad. Perfect.

f8nd50c0Fus-6xS-lq3OYQ.text: Absolutely delicious!  I just finished lunch with friends and my toddler, and everyone left happy.  The grown up fish and chips has the tastiest, flakiest batter ever.  And the homemade fish fingers are perfect for the little ones.  Unlike many fish and chip places, there are some lighter things on the menu to balance it out, tasty salads (dill and fennel - YUM!), and you can have your fish grilled too.  And you should probably order two of the calamari.  The decor is sweet and old fashioned, with white tiles on the wall and simple tables and chairs.  I can't wait to go back!

eyI6VGBUBbr_JLBlGLgPZQ.text: So I've been resisting going in here because it looked a bit like a place that would try and make fish and chips all posh and ridiculously expensive. That's not what I think fish and chips is all about.Anyway, how wrong my perception was. I just had battered Pollack and chips, the missus had Matzo fried Plaice and chips and the boy had fish nuggets and chips, drinks and extra tartare sauce and the bill came to £20 odd pounds. About a fiver more than I'd expect to pay in a bog standard chippie. Difference being that this was some of the best fish and chips I've eaten. The batter on my pollack was thin crispy and totally exceptional. The fish inside cooked absolutely perfectly. Moist. Unmistakeably fresh fillet too. The plaice was cooked with the same care. I didn't get to try the nuggets because they got wolfed down.Chips were like a good version of normal chip shop chips. Not the ridiculous posh chunks you get in good restaurants. Not the greasy mess you get in the chippie. Just a good quantity of well prepared chips. moreish. Filling. Lovely. We bought some tartare sauce for 30p.It came in a huge pot and was lush home made mayonnaise with chopped gherkin and fresh dill. Delicious. And to think that we pay 10p for that rubbish in sachets at a lot of places. Great stuff.We ate in. Nice surroundings. A little spartan for me to be honest and lacking atmos, but who cares? That was fish and chips as is should be at an excellent fair price. An absolute winner.There is obviously a good culture there. They have literature which talks about getting their stuff from only sustainable sources which is becoming more and more important. I'll be showing my support by eating lots and lots of fish and chips from there from now on. Got to be committed and all that!

yaEATx5QR5t99EqHDkJwIw.text: This place was wowzers!!! We kind of got lost on the way there since I am from the states but when I got there all my frustration went away.  Easily the greatest fish and chips I have ever had, we ordered he cod, calamari, and the onion rings.  The onion rings are ridiculously amazing.  This place is the perfect definition of a English fish and chips joint!  A must if you're in London!

xVq42AvaEanfXpq1ojKHKQ.text: Outside of London I'm sure this wouldn't have the reverence it has. What it offers is good quality fish and chips, nothing more, nothing less. Anywhere else and it'd have competition, but the fact that there isn't anything to compare is what causes people to gush about this place.It's damn good though, and good fish and chips can be such a rarity that I'll forgive its price inflation for what you get. When I say good, I mean well cooked fish, freshly battered with not too much and chips that have the perfect balance of cripness and softness.Perhaps the two things which make this a cut above the rest are:1. The place doesn't smell of fish.It's rare for anywhere that deals in fish prep not to have this, but it is possible. That smell is not a good smell or standard for any fishery. It just means that they are not serious about cleaning the place.2. Your food is prepared freshly for you.Takes a bit longer, but the net result is food that hasn't been sitting under a hot lamp, slowly spoiling.Simple things done well. None of this should be notable, but the fact it is shows that they've spotted their gap and are doing it well.Pro tip: Want fish and chips but want to pretend you're not a fatty fat fat? Go for the mazo meal covering on the fish instead. Still tastes damn good, but a lot less battery than batter.

ToA_SA9634ds0IO32NGi4w.text: In my first couple of weeks in London I was very excited to see a fish and chips event and also get chosen for this Qype event! There can't be a better way to start my new food adventures in London than with the national dish. Wandering in a few minutes late, I was warmly greeted with a delicious glass of Muscadet which I preferred over my next favorite, a bottle of dandelion and burdock. They also provided glasses of sherry which I personally was not a huge fan of. Being a fish and chips novice, I was pleased that there are many beverage options to pair with. For whatever reason I thought beer was the standard pairing. They started out the night with some whitebait and calamari in a deliciously light batter which paired perfectly with the bubbly Muscadet. The owners Nick and Saul told us not only everything we need to know about fish and chips in general, but why they do what they do to provide the best product possible.This means fresh not frozen fish, no preservatives, and homemade batter. We were provided a sample of 1. Three preparations of fish (grilled, matzo, and battered)- My favorite of the night was the battered. Perfectly crisp outside with a tempura like texture. This fish was lusciously moist and fresh of course! 2. Chips- Just the right amount of crunch with fluffy white goodness inside and also not too salty 3. Mushy peas- This was my first time trying mushy peas ever and it was delicious. To me, the name doesn't sound so appetizing but I could have licked my plate clean if that wasn't so inappropriate. 4. and a wonderfully refreshing fennel and dill salad To top it off, the ambiance was clean, warm and inviting. I will be back for sure when I need to fulfill my fish and chip cravings!

ryrHD0Tr2H31QuXbTqE7Ng.text: Kerbisher and Malt certainly isn't your average chippy. For one, they serve alcohol which instantly makes it better and secondly you won't find any dehydrated saveloys on the menu here. In fact, Kerbisher and Malt don't even serve meat, but don't let this put you off; Kerbisher are passionate about their fish, so much so that they don't open on Mondays as Billingsgate Fish Market is closed on this day, meaning no fresh fish. I was lucky enough to try a selection of their fish at the Qype event on Monday: breaded, battered and steamed. I have to say that of all the varieties the battered was my favourite. The batter was delicious and what really set Kerbisher and Malt apart from other chip shops was their chips, delightfully crispy and cooked twice. I'm a huge fan of their sides and I couldn't get enough of the lemon mayonnaise.

SIL7zqkvpQSm9uvrU_VrUw.text: Came here last night for the Qype Night, literally off the plane from Germany so it was delight to arrive straight into a great informal session on the history, variations and science behind the nations favourite dish. The hosts were fab, the food was really good and it was great to hear their story on why and how they set up in the first pla(i)ce. I think it would be pretty difficult to find a better (batter) chippy, pretty well in the whole world! I will never look at a battered cod in the same way again. Beer or no beer, skin or no skin, it was all explained. Delicious and informative evening all round. Congrats on a great business, guys..

_xtbFbkDhGOzg1lF4AD9lQ.text: I only like my fish deep fried and cod So I was slightly apprehensive about going to fish and chip tasting here, especially when presented with 3 different fish (one was cod, phew) to try and one of them was grilled! But as I'm never one to be impolite and turn down free food I gave it a go, and I'm so glad I did! It was the best fish I've ever tasted, combined with top notch chips, an amazing fennel salad (if nothing else you must order that) and a large glass of wine it was quite simply delicious. The staff really know what they are talking about so if you want any recommendations or to try something new, ask. Anyway to sum up, I'm a changed man now I only like my fish deep fried and cod unless it is from kerbisher and malt

P_FtUvvaGTM0dRRgCevs_w.text: On Tuesday evening Lanky Girl and Co went to an event hosted by Qype at Kerbisher and Malt a rather cute and contemporary chip shop on Shepherds Bush Road in Hammersmith. Fish and Chips are one of those dishes that everyone tends to have strong opinions about. I went to the event thinking I knew as much as there was to know about fish and chips but came away surprised at how much I didn't know. Being brought up in East London I can remember enjoying countless trips to our local chip shop Brothers when either of my parents couldn't be bothered to cook. No other chip shop I have visited has been able to better my childhood chippy until now! Kerbisher and Malt's selling point is the fact that the food is stripped down, unadulterated and tasty! For the environmentally conscious it is helpful to know that: The fish they buy is fresh and bought unfrozen from Billingsgate market from sustainable stock.They make their own batter from scratch and fish is available to buy battered, grilled or covered in matzo meal. The chips are double fried and the oil they use is recycled into bio fuel. I was particularly impressed when they told us their food was free from preservatives and additives.On entering the restaurant we were received by founders Nick and Saul who proceeded to give us a history of how they started and what makes their fish and chips so good. We were also were given fried calamari that I'm not embarrassed to say I could not stop eating! To try we were given Cod, Coley and haddock to try and many of us could not tell the difference much to my chagrin. For someone who doesn't like batter having the option of grilled fish was perfect. The fish tasted fresh, perfectly cooked and delicious. We also enjoyed chips, fennel salad, homemade baked beans and a glass of sherry. By the end of the meal I was stuffed and smiling! Kerbisher and Malt definitely deserve the praise that has seen it voted best contemporary chip shop in Britain by Esquire magazine. Lanky Girl's verdict? Easily the best fish and chips I have tasted in a long time. Next time you're in Hammersmith definitely pay them a visit.

RZ7IwDInVpkum1nXPlGmYg.text: Brilliant fish (thin batter, matzo or grilled  all lovely), great chips, the very best onion rings I've ever tasted (cannot emphasize this enough) and outstanding homemade tartar sauce. Very good value for money, and added bonus fully licensed to sell alcohol.The friendly owners put their emphasis on simple, fresh, natural ingredients and are genuinely passionate about doing our national dish justice. It makes you wonder why all chippies aren't like this.

21H1bQWTSMiOjvJlrAxTfg.text: Holy freaking god. There are no two ways about it: this place serves up the best chip-shop fish that I have ever eaten in my whole life, ever. Ever.The only reason I knew of Kerbisher & Malt's existence was reading a mention of it as being the "best fish and chip shop in London". Turns out, according to their menu, that I got the accolade slightly wrong; in fact, it was named London's "best contemporary chippy" by Esquire magazine. Still, that's not to be sniffed at, and since it is a mere five minute drive from my new pad, it seemed frankly daft not to give it a go.My mum and I - self-proclaimed connoisseurs of this traditional dish - popped in post-decoration of the aforementioned new pad, exhausted and covered in paint. We ordered two battered haddock and chips, one side of mushy peas, one beer and one lemonade which came to about £25.But firstly, the fish itself. Oh, but it was divine; cooked to perfection and falling apart in succulent, juicy flakes. Alongside the traditional dishes they offer a range of cooking methods (battered, grilled or matzo meal). The Jewish side of me lurched towards the latter but I'm English born-and-bred so plumped for the popular option: an indescribably light and fluffy batter with the perfect crisp coverage; no open spaces, no excess dripping off the edge. The chips were not, perhaps, as good as those found at the excellent Mrs Marengos, which in my opinion are virtually impossible to surpass, but nonetheless a great complement to the main dish. The mushy peas could perhaps have done with a little extra seasoning and a bit more cooking of the solid peas themselves.  I would have had the homemade tartare sauce but unfortunately ordered in too much of a hurry to notice its existence on the menu.  Part of me thinks that that was probably a good thing, because it allowed me to enjoy the deliciousness of the fish in all its glory with no culinary distractions.Kerbisher & Malt has a feeling like it ought to be over in east London somewhere - not due to pretentions or being painfully hip, but perhaps down to its clean, retro-modern intererior and quietly British theme - but as a west-London girl, I'm delighted that it isn't. I loved the decor and the friendly staff (my meal was cheerfully delivered by the chef himself) and the carefully-chosen menu, which was pleasantly extensive but not overly taxing in terms of making a decision.  They have four beers, all from the London brewery Meantime (in keeping with the "local produce"), plus a range of soft drinks from Fentimans. My mum had a lemonade which was so good that she ordered another. Yup, even the drinks are excellent.This place so nearly gets five stars from me - in fact, I wavered between four and five several times whilst writing this review - but I think that it *just* misses out. It's a 4.5, which is a shame because the fish really is phenomenal and the service is delightful, but I'm going to be harsh if only because the restaurant is still in its infancy and therefore has plenty of opportunity for improvement. If they can perfect the chips and the peas, then they won't be able to keep me away. I honestly didn't want that haddock to end. I savoured every morsel and wiped my plate clean. I'll be back . . . just try and stop me.

gGyAlXp7StoGNuymfXLNiQ.text: If someone asked you what alcohol went best with chips, would you have a clue? Well, thanks to Kerbisher and Malt, I would. The answer is sherry! This is just one of the many great things that I learnt about Britain's national dish at the latest Qype event. I also learnt that fish tastes better with the skin off and that fennel and dill salad is a great counterpart to fish and chips. Although it has to be said not as great a counterpart as Kerbisher and Malt's own lemon mayonnaise  that stuff is so tasty that I was tempted to stock up while I was here. It's a bargain at just 50p! Of course, unless you're me, you probably won't visit here just for lemon mayonnaise, and I'm pleased to report that the fish and chips are delicious. We tried three varieties of fish and of them all, the battered fish was my favourite. The batter was light and crisp, and I couldn't get enough of the chips which are double-cooked to their own unique recipe. Coming from the coast, I thought that it wasn't possible to get good fish and chips in London, but Kerbisher and Malt have proved me so wrong. I'll definitely be coming here again and not just for the mayonnaise!

rO77AJhm4cxCjIHgpN8Hiw.text: Unlike most of the reviewers here we didn't go to a special (free?) event at this chippy, we just turned up for something to eat before a gig at Shepherd's Bush Empire. From the rave reviews in the press I was expecting a transcendental experience complete with crispy batter and pickled eggs. Instead I had some quite nice fish and chips  but at a price. You can get salad too which is quite unheard of in rival establishments. One of my friends would have preferred the mushy peas to be a bit less sloppy. It's okay  but I am not entirely convinced.

jl4KjEoblcBmbQw8jschVA.text: So I was invited and head the pleasure to visit my favourite chippy Kerbisher and Malt. It was pleasant for the owners to teach us about getting 'good fish and chips' and this is the reason why I think they are so ahead of the market. Arrived and enjoyed the networking and complimentary drinks and au d'oeuvres. Amazing. The owners Saul and Nick introduced their concept and advised the difference on how they source and make their fish and chips. It was interesting as it certainly tells in the flavour. Much to everyones joy we were provided with three different types of fish and each one was cooked in a different way, battered, grilled or Matzo which is breadcrumbed. The chips were cooked twice and this provided a crispy lovely chip not too chunky and not too think like fries. These were complimented with their own made lemon mayonnaise, sweet chilli sauce and tartare. Not want to sound too much like a critic but these were amazing. Cannot fault. All sides were sampled and plenty offered and have to champion the mushy peas and home made baked beans. These made the meal complete and my table was quiet. We were served Muscadet, sherry and additional soft drinks. I normally have a soft drink with my fish and chips. As we had an American who just had arrived to London we thought it was good to give her Dandelion and Burdock and she loved it! It was a joy to hear Kerbisher and Malts view on what they were serving and could clearly see their passion hypnotising the rest of us. Saul and Nick were clearly open to hear all thoughts and opinions and you know what they had them all covered. They have perfected a good nights meal here. Well done for T to organise this event and long live Kerbisher and Malt.

--WBpylYZWkxRRcOcbDPSA.text: Very cool looking chippy in Brook Green with the best fish I've had in years. Amazing haddock & chips!

Rackham Çevirisi But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure? Rackham Çevirisi On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains.

iUi7CvSFiR-HwUFdaD5UjQ.text: Great first meal to have in london! We were very hungry after our flight and dropping off our luggage at the hotel so we looked up the best places to eat nearby. K&M was down the street and the reviews were amazing so we made a unanimous decision to come here! The yelp page doesn't have the right hours posted so we came a little too early before they opened for dinner, but they had outdoor seatings so we waited until they opened. The girl taking our order was very friendly and took our order quickly. I ordered the fish(haddock)& chips of course and they were absolutely amazing! They came out steaming hot and the fish was very juicy and tender on the inside while the outside was fried to perfection.Only downside was the puddle of oil at the bottom of my plate which made it a little unappetizing everytime i tried forking a chip and all the oil would ooze/bubble around it. I got sick of it faster as well because of the oil so i didn't finish all my food, but the portions are also very large so that could also be a reason why. Seems like this is the go to place for locals and tourists trying to grab some good authentic fish&chips so this is definitely a must try for everyone! I have to look for a shop selling fish&chips as delicious as K&M in the LA area now, but this will probably be the best i will ever have. If i ever decide to come back to london, i'm definitely stopping by again!

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Haddock fish&chips with tartare sauce

6RL3ZA6zZxBZ4wCJ7y_Iog.text: Delicious fish & chips & mushy peas & beer! Simply add a friend and leave feeling satisfied and in control of your life.

W1xHYj72R0a3vMfIce-JJA.text: No better anywhere in my 60 years on the planet! Fresh, clean, great texture simply the best I have ever had in my life and I have been around the world! I don't eat fried potatoes, and I dislike ketchup immensely so I ordered the fennel salad with fresh dill which was the perfect accompaniment with the fish! I was in heaven!!!! Great job K&M, I am not easy to please but you exceeded this "foodies" expectations and then some! Cheers to you!

iNi1K3T34gu-WVuX8Q49Tg.text: I learned of K&M after reading an article about the ten best fish/chip places in London.  Glad I did.  This place is a ten minute walk from the Shepherd's Bush station, so it doesn't draw many tourists (which is good).  Decor is very modern... Loved the subway tile walls. Staff: very friendly and welcoming. Food:  oh.em.gee.  I ordered the batter fried coley with chips.   Not only the portions were generous, but they were beautifully fried to crispy, golden perfection.  The fish was tender, flaky and so fresh....the fries were crunchy and elegant.  My stomach was stuffed and joyous.  This New Yorker is a fan.

QS2snv5ASjG31eR65qJOBA.text: I have been on the quest to find the best fish and chip shop in the UK and K&M has won out. Did you hear me? Best fish and chips in the UK. I have not found a place I prefer more than here!Fresh fish with the perfect batter. You can get your fish battered, grilled, or baked for those who are health conscious. Excellent calamari, chips, and mushy peas. Don't forget to wash it all down with a nice bottle of their wheat beer...This place is already busy enough without glowing reviews on Yelp, however, sometimes you just want to share a place that brings so much joy!

B5P1N0vo_-jZXjaXcmDltQ.text: Glitzy fish and chips just ain't right and this joint proves the point.  I've eaten here a couple of times and sadly on both occasions I found the fish quite greasy....  I think they must be either cooking it at too low a temperature or they are over crowding the oil.

SdycrIjAruPxexLhQyXNdw.text: Best Fish and Chips in London!! You gotta go. Cod and Haddock are amazing, id say 10/10 with chips 9/10.

w9_fma0RNI1-pPvA_YEj_g.text: I can not express how awful the fish and chips i had was at this so called fish and chip shop  , truly un professional job , chips over cooked greasy small !! Asked if i wanted my fish battered !!! How can you have fish and chips with out battered fish !!! Then charged extra for it more then the price mentioned in their menu , but that would have been OK if the food was good or even acceptable , This place has nothing to do with traditional fish and chips .

1Yn3T0DtYO0crpEjqm3kdA.text: I really liked this Chip shop. You have your choice of 5 different types of fish and a selection of sides. The mushy peas were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom

UXznOCHI6UGNW682qrr7-w.text: I had the breaded haddock and it was unbelievable, as were the chips and tartare. The setting is also very charming, and the service was friendly and efficient. Can't ask for more.

sEUkRZTdtPyhSwegrtpYJw.text: How fish and chips were meant to be.  The cod melts like butter yet the batter is very crispy.  There wasn't one dry portion of the whole fish, and no bones.  It was velvety smooth. The tartar sauce tastes homemade, best I've had in my life.  The chips were good but nothing special.  Service is good too even though they are always busy. I've been coming to London for 15 years and I've never felt I was really in London until eating here.

HYyilioQfzk8ZlirYqJSAQ.text: After doing some research to try and find the best fish and chips in London, we chose Kerbisher & Malt. It was fantastic... not much to add to the other reviews.  Best I've ever had? Maybe... at a minimum it was in the top three.

kHYGs_dxXcIrEj5cxR-ssA.text: You are a short tube ride away from THE BEST fish and chips - and in a quaint environment and cool little neighborhood. We had the haddock. Ordered sides of cole slaw and potato salad too. Cole slaw was "meh," but the rest was awesome. Potato salad was very unique with red onions. Me like. Paired with a pale ale while we sat outside and enjoyed life. What a great night at a great place.

3jnze4EAZsLi78-BalhznA.text: In attempt to get a "bikini friendly" body for summer I've taken to walking the three miles from my office to home every evening. I'm full of self-congratulations and smuggness up until I walk past Kerbisher & Malt. The smell alone makes me want to erase all my good-doing with a healthy dose of fried naughtiness.Believe me, I was doing oh-so-well until one wet and windy Friday night when I couldn't crack it any more. I called my flat mate, ending with the words "I'll meet you there". Inside, it felt like THIS is the way fish and chips should be done. Retro decor, friendly smiley girls behind the counter. A great range of sides and condiments and fast service. One of my favourite elements of this tiny restaurant is that they have a screen of the kitchen, so you can see the chefs at work. Makes the short waiting time fly by!The food, to be honest, was a little disappointing. It could be my common palate, but I couldn't help dismissing the fact that the fish was friendly-farmed, the tartare sauce was homemade and the ginger beer was organic. The chips were a little soggy (lacked that crispy/greasy/guilty element of most fish and chip shop chips) and the fish tasted very average. at £10 a head for a non-alcoholic drink, fish, chips, mushy peas and tarare sauce - it's better value than most fish and chip places any road. What I'd go back for is the sense of community spirit they created in such a small, new place. The waitresses greating old boys and girls like they were family. Leaving us with a "hope to see you again soon!". And I'm sure they will!

OGRi17G87IwBkslhIwmcEA.text: Nice spot with good design, great service, and passable fish and chips.  My haddock was very soft -- not a characteristic of haddock -- and though the batter was crispy and flavourful, I find it impossible to excuse if the actual fish is bad.  I know some people love flaky soft fish, but I am not one of those people.  If I ordered haddock and haddock was known as a soft fish then I would blame myself for ordering contrary to my preferences.  However, I expected certain common qualities to Haddock and sadly they were lacking.The chips were quite delicious, but so are the chips at my shitty local fish shop so I am not going to give this place a better rating simply because they didn't screw up something that almost no one screws up.I wouldn't go back (I wouldn't dissuade someone too strongly)- but I wouldn't recommend it either.

Cjcl0JUVItFKcPA3An3tNQ.text: I was craving some good fish and chips on my last afternoon in London.  I could have gone to any neighborhood pub and gotten a decent plate, but something prompted me to search Yelp and this place came up.  It was a quick 10 minute walk from the Shepherd's Bush tube station and it was WORTH IT!  The fish were battered perfectly and not too greasy.   I had a delicious piece of haddock, but could have chosen from 4 other types of fish and probably all would have tasted as good.   They offer a choice of grilled fish too, which is a nice alternative, and there are some lighter things on the menu like good salads.  The chips were tasty too.  The only ding was they charged 50p for tartar sauce, but I will say that it was the best tartar sauce I have ever had - it tasted homemade.  I will be back on my next visit to London.

tQS7Qc8F7xhBfBVE6_-beg.text: Yummy fish and chips here. The cod that I ordered was huge and the beer was really good. I wasn't too much of a fan of the chips but the fish was so damn good. I don't have anything to compare it to but I can imagine that it's one of the best places to feed a fish and chip craving.

Xsq_lfDoHCj6pjNX1kJgmA.text: Kerbisher and Malt!What a delight.It was great to meet the owners and listen to their vision for their unique west london chippie.We were greeted to many delights, my favourite were the lightly battered fried squid.tender juicy just the way they should be.Next we had a trio of fish,haddock,cod and coley.It was a mystery guessing which was which.One grilled, one battered one in matzo bread crumbs.Needless to say I got it wrong!My usual favorite cod was grilled and I did not recognise it!I decided to end the meal with ice cream salted carame itl was just perfect.

Xj__E2IlYqpKUp2_UUvi7A.text: Came here for dinner and we ordered fried Plaice with sweet chili sauce, fried Haddock with lemon mayonnaise, mushy peas, and calamari.  For drinks we ordered Rose lemonade, and Dandelion and Burdock.  The drinks were very interesting.  We don't have anything like this in the states.  Out of those 2, I would recommend the Rose lemonade.  The Dandelion drink has a licorice and ginger taste.  If you like that combination, feel free to get it.  The calamari was lightly fried and it was not rubbery.  It does have some seasoning, but not enough.  If you pair the calamari with the sweet chili sauce, it raises the dish to another flavor profile.  I highly recommend this combination.  As for the fishes, both were fresh, flaked off nicely and lightly fried.  The portions of the fish were HUGE.  I recommend sharing one order.  My only issue with the fried fish is that by the time you finish 1/3 of the fish, it gets difficult to continue to eat all that fried stuff.  I just took off the fried stuff and just ate the fish.  The Plaice is a little fattier than the Haddock.  The Haddock is definitely a thicker fish with more meat.  The mushy peas is exactly as it sounds, peas all mushed up.  It's different but it would taste even better if they added some kind of seasoning.  Overall, the meal was much better than what we had at fish!.  I would recommend this place over fish! because this place is cheaper, tasty, and their calamari isn't rubbery.  The staff here was very friendly and helpful when deciding what to order.  They don't have a lot of seats so I would advise against parties bigger than 4 here.    This place accepts credit cards.

wc5fhl3gyLbDoMlhgip0Ew.text: Amazing fish and chips. Best in the UK is a bold claim and I haven't tried enough to say that's true, but I find it hard to get nice fish and chips in West London and this is definitely the best around here. Great selection of Meantime beers too.

vbTug7Qs-mJ4RVai7FrBoQ.text: Great spot to grab fish and chips.. We were looking for a spot that had a contemporary vibe along with the traditional recipes.. We found it here.

OnpQ3gX5wRcRxEkU5pSQ1A.text: Well, I've been living in London for just short of four years and decided it was time to try fish and chips. Truth be told, I've never thought of myself as a fish and chips type of chick which is why it's taken me so long to try this beloved dish. For me, the meal was just too much fried food which was completely expected since I was eating fried fish and chips (and onion rings). None of it sat well with me and I was up all night with heartburn but that's not really the fault of Kerbisher & Malt. I just can't handle fried food and this meal was fried food overload.Together, my husband and ordered a battered plaice, battered cod, onion rings, chips, coleslaw, and two brews (delicious).My plaice was bland. There was absolutely no seasoning in the breading. Since I don't do tartar or any type of sauce (I like it straight-up with lemon juice which there wasn't enough of), I basically ate fried batter and fish and it tasted like nothing. I should have ordered a side of fennel and dill because I think that probably would have bumped this review up to four stars.The chips were good. The onion rings were good but they caused me to burp onion burps for the next 24 hours which is not sexy at all. The coleslaw was downright terrible. No flavor or even flavour. The space is neat. Loved the white subway tile and the menu painted on the wall. Seating was comfortable and ordering was orderly and easy. Food came out quick with no fuss.The space is also small with seating for about 20 people. There is a very long table which seats 12 which was filled with three separate groups of American tourists who "made it all the way to Hammersmith" to try the fish and chips. LOL.Would not return for the mere fact that I'm not a fish and chips lover and for me to eat fish and chips, it's got to be really damn good fish and chips.

3RZcmFJXW2CIObihj7wHPw.text: We were visiting London recently and discovered this place via Yelp. Overall, we were really happy with the fish & chips! Delicious, greasy and just what we wanted. A bit pricey, but then we realized EVERYTHING is pricey in London. Glad we stopped by as it's a cute, simple ambiance.

MdjxnlY2jBqcQPCd5aaNpw.text: I agree with the other user reviews here - the fish is absolutely fantastic. The chips - while they're quite good and taste better than your run of the mill bar chips - are only "good". Their sauce selection is worthwhile and their drink selection is nice. Though the chips fell just a bit flat, the experience overall was marvelous. Friendly staff and prompt service.Highly recommended for anyone searching for the quintessential fish and chips experience while in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. It is a quaint little restaurant kiddy-corner from a park. Very nice and clean.
Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. This is the beer battered cod with chips (and a Coke). Fish was great - but the chips could use a little something more.

xxg_ejaZFo1Rl5s7rnneqw.text: Excellent fish and chips. Definitely recommend to others. You'll have a great time here. But do you get here early. There is limited seating. Enjoy yourself. They have great chips. They have good fish. They don't charge you extra for grilling, frying, battering. We did try the haddock, cod and the seafood Fishcake. We also tried the chips with sweet chili sauce. Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Haddock & chips
Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Cod

Her0nt1X9Mhv1QbyrmXQGQ.text: Our Air B&B host recommended Kerbisher & Malt for fish & chips. I hadn't had it in over a decade, but I like pretty much anything fried, so I knew I was guaranteed to eat whatever was put in front of me.I wasn't expecting this to be as good as it was!! I'm ashamed to say I ate it all. (If you've been reading my other reviews, you'll notice a trend.) I had the battered haddock with chips, and everything was cooked so perfectly. The fish is cooked to order, so it was super fresh and not greasy at all. (I'm looking back at my picture and can't believe I ate the whole thing - the piece of fish was HUGE!) I had it with tartare sauce and a bottle of cider. As simple as this dish is, I don't think it could have gotten any better than that. K&M itself has sort of a kitchen / cafeteria vibe, with bright lights and a clean, casual setting. I wouldn't necessarily come here for a date night, but I would come running for their fish & chips again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom

NLU_h8fErdrQiLKINXeYOA.text: This is a very nice fish and chip shop, with good quality fish. The chips are decent and the fish is well done, the only reason I give this 4 stars is due to the fact that it is more expensive than similar standard places. It's a tad overpriced, especially if you take away the modern aesthetic of the restaurant. The fish is fresh though, despite being in London, so I give it 4 stars. I would recommend if you don't mind forking out a little extra money for a good meal.

vlIgCvEY1RVH60oEArl2QQ.text: This came up as the best fish and chips in London so we trekked to Kensington just for this.  We ordered a haddock fish and chips combo, and a calamari lunch special with salad.  The British sure know how to do fish.  The fish was amazingly fried!   The batter is somehow super crisp and so delicious, and the fish is super tender.  That plus the mushy peas were excellent.  The chips were a bit dense and not super crisp, and we've had better elsewhere.  The calamari was ok, but the side salad that came with it was a delight, with fresh greens and cucumber and tomato, topped with pomegranate seeds.

JeOlOqlDrMtTeDucrf1Ttw.text: I am so glad we tried this Yelp recommendation. Let me warn you that the portions are very, very big - we ended up over-ordering. The fried haddock was so moist with a perfect crust and the chips were great, but the sauces put it over the top: the homemade tarter, the chipotle mayo and red curry sauces were delish! I would've been satisfied with the malt vinegar but the sauces were such an added plus. Now here's where it got my fifth star - the mushy peas. They were so good, I would go here just for them. They also served their own beer by the bottle to tie things all together, plus a few other tasty microbrews. The salad was fresh, but my favorite side after the peas was the fennel and dill salad. They has a children's menu and even provided colored pencils. The service was quick,  attentive and extremely friendly.

eF_qV4u-fEL3c_xSsD2Low.text: SO SO GOOD! I have driven by this place so many times and always think, I really need to try this out and am so glad I finally did. Kerbisher & Malt is a small chippy right between Shepherds Bush and Hammersmith. The interior is really nice, subway tiles down the walls, bright and very clean. I had the small fish and chips special. A small portion of coley, chips and a sauce for a fiver. First off, this wasnt small, I couldnt finish all the chips. It was so good! Hot, not greasy at all and no bones. Plus it was at least half the price of getting it at a pub. There were about 5 types of fish and a good selection of sauces as well. There were also some non fish choices on the menu. They had bottled beer and various sodas and waters  to drink. I am delighted to have found something so close to home when I have a craving and nice to know I can eat in or take away. Will absolutely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Love me a deal!
Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. "Small" fish and chips

_2J92tKIa9WGF7oGJRsqqA.text: This is some sort of up-scale fish and chips diner.The food was good but if you ask me not better than in any of the shabbier, more basic fish and chips diners scattered all over London.The difference, apart from the pleasant décor, is that here you can get some yummy sides and salads (mushy peas, crunched potatoes etc) to go with your fish and chips.All in all good if you are around Hammersmith, but don't come here from the other end of London just to try this restaurant. It's probably not worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Fish cake with chips, mushy peas, crunched potatoes

a-BCC9tjfGBX5fPtku1lRw.text: So we'll say about a 4...honestly, it clocks a 4 because their range of offerings were pretty amazing and creative. The fish was also really good. No need to say flaky and well prepared, I mean it's frying fish...honestly. But the chips were disappointing. See to date the only one that has pulled off the balance in all regards is FishClub in Clapham Common(they say Clapham Junction has one), but somehow they closed...go figure. But this was close. Chips had some leftover chips from earlier and not just a few. But staff were really nice polite and very accommodating...i'll check out their Abbeville road location to check for consistency. But go, it's honestly a good meal and really filling.

p57z8C_TDzPzskU1mNVzrQ.text: FishIs so so Chips Is dry And this place used to be better  uses to be Way way better my old rating use gk be 4 stars

0sa7ErUOyYBRisktJ6W_Mw.text: Friend tipped me off to this place. The quality and taste is tops.  Be sure and get there before they run out of chips or your choice of fish.   Im told other locations are open on monday this is not.

50GbBZ4egMJ8IyTKbjn-6Q.text: A little bit pricey compared to your local chippy but WELL worth it.Fantastic fish and chips, whitebait and crispy squid. Easily the best I've had in London. READ THAT AGAIN!Great location and friendly staff as well. Do yourself a favour and spend a few bob more than usual on a great dinner in Hammersmith.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips, Calamari and Whitebait. All done perfectly.

jc8GQ7GTYyHbwX7DyJ6m1A.text: It has been a long time since I last visited Kerbisher and Malt and the fishes were still as good as ever. The Lunch deal here is a steal, costing 5 pounds from fish burger, min fish & chips to fish cake. The fishes were soft and fresh, miles ahead of your standard local chippies, however the chips seasoning was lacking just like before which was a shame.

o4M3H0dRE3uxyxcxGIqWow.text: Oh my gosh, the fish and chips. GOOD LORD THE FISH AND CHIPS!!!!!!!This is an amazing little place, especially after a few drinks at the near by pub- The Richmond. You'll be hungry after those few drinks, trust me- and Kerbisher and Malt is the only acceptable place to get your grub on while stumbling home at 11 at night :PI always have the fish and chips- the fish is so flavorful, and the chips are so crisp and fluffy. There's no grease, and hardly any bones! Wonderful.

2npSA2VfxF-LwZtLIEyejg.text: Really good place for affordable fish and chips. They also accept the taste card so if you can save even more. The quality of the fish is really good and their mushy peas are tasty. You should also try their homemade tartare sauce.

S4yIorR70O7Omh2S449ckw.text: Kerbisher & Malt is often held aloft as the standard for fish and chips in London. I'd say it majors more on the fish than the chips. It's a pretty simple format: wander up to the till, choose your food (including a range of different possible fish), pay and wait. The interior is tiled and slightly retro. The service is friendly.The food however was overall slightly below what I was expecting given its reputation. The fish is indeed excellent - quite possibly indeed the best battered fish I've had in London. However, the chips were quite a bit below par in a city that now touts several excellent burger joints alongside established greasy spoons like the Regency Cafe in Westminster. And alas, my first servings of mushy peas tasted burnt. The replacements were much better.So overall, pretty good - particularly the fish. There's room for improvement on the chips though.

eMucGmQc3tf_yLkx1Of8gw.text: I was in London for two nights, I wanted to have one of the typical plates and after searching and deciding which restaurant i would go to for fish & chips, I decided to try Kirbirsher & Malt.I was really disappointed with the fish, I ordered and took my food back to the hotel which was about 10 minutes by foot and when I finally unwrapped everything, there was no tartar sauce or any sauce for that, no napkins, the fish was soggy and the chips were just ok.The prices at this place are through the roof, I understand that London is an expensive city, but some of these restaurants need to come back to reality on the prices. I'm pretty sure that the food here is really good, but they dropped the ball this time. I would really love to go back to London, but my next fish & chips will not be from here.

qU06n_vFlFq_pqUE9PqEsA.text: An absolute blessing being walking distance from this great fish and chips place! The manager and cashier were beyond great! The manager was accommodating and very nice. The cod was so flaky and the batter was perfect. Try the gherkin if you like pickles. I'll be coming back for more of them before I leave. Lemon mayo of to die for. Great stop on a trip to London.

8lZJN1i8WNUMseNpeeRFWA.text: ... well, doesn't time fly, six years since my enthusiastic review! If you arrive at quarter to ten on a Friday night, Kerbisher & Malt has the same ambience of every fish & chips show in London. Tired and drunk people spotted around the tables adding beer breath to the greasy air.Staff were extremely unwelcoming - not surprisingly, we found out they were focused on closing in 15 minutes and not particularly interested in new customers. One was clearing tables without looking up, the one behind the corner was beyond commenting on the menu but luckily told us we had just a few minutes before the place closed.With a different attitude they could probably have persuaded us to order and finish our meal outside, I'm glad they didn't even try as we chanced upon the most charming cafe just a few minutes away.

PyHLJGtezwN8YFTNbIsf6w.text: Best fish & chips I've ever had in London hands down!!!  Staff were very friendly and accommodating with our children.  We will definitely seek this place out on our next family romp in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom

kksmMsH887_VbCVqCC3GiQ.text: The location is great-right near BrewDog. Although they do have drinks there, I'd recommend BrewDog first. Anyways, the quality of this fish and chips was my preferred of the two places we tried. The portions are very large to boot. My husband and I each ordered a fish and chips meal-his with cod and mine with haddock. Instead of mushy peas, we asked for double chips but were told they can't do that (ok.....). The fish was flaky and the batter was crisp. The chips were hot, fresh cut, and crisp. They lacked flavor though. They sell extra sauces so we tried the chipotle mayonnaise, which was superior (IMO) to the tarter sauce. It was delicious with both the chips and fish. I'd suggest ordering 2. The atmosphere is very casual in that you order at the counter and pay with your food being delivered to your table later. They also do a brisk takeaway business. I was satisfied with our meal here and found the price point to be reasonable for the quality and quantity of food. I'd definitely suggest visiting if you are in the area and looking for fish and chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips
Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

ZIoA6rT8s8B5FoUUgTTOIA.text: Wonderful!  So glad we found this place our first day in London.  We'll be back.  Tartare sauce was fabulous.  Cod and Chips were everything we hoped for as well.

Ic2E7KkWirzCwj0W62hjnw.text: Meal: Dinner, dine inAll Ratings out of 10:Quality of food: 8Food to Spend Value: 8Quality of Service: 8Overall Rating: 8I had to try true British fish and chips at least once while in London. After talking with a few folks, I received a lot of recommendations for Kerbisher & Malt. So for a mid-week dinner in the Hammersmith area, I headed over to see what I thought.There were 5 different kinds of fish on the menu, several which I was familiar with (haddock and cod), and a few I was not. I decided to try Plaice, battered of course, with chips and a side of mushy peas and bread and butter. The fish had a flaky texture to it and was quite juicy, and the batter on the fish was very well done. British beer battering is definitely different from a lot of fish and chips found stateside, but I enjoyed the flavor and texture quite a bit. The mushy peas were not my cup of tea, but I was glad I tried them, as they were prepared well. The fries that came with the fish were quite good and are fresh cut in house. You could taste the freshness, and the double frying really did them justice.Kerbisher & Malt is unassuming from the outside and fairly small inside. You order your food first, find a table, and they bring it out to you when it is ready. The prices were very reasonable, the portion sizes good, and the quality also quite good. I personally prefer fish and chips I get in coastal cities in the US to the British variety, but even so I really enjoyed my meal and would definitely return when back in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Beer battered plaice and chips

GKUoox3CExVynNM1vfGtXw.text: Good stuff. Staff are a bit impersonal, but food is great. Chip portions are too big and the chip doesn't really get a lot of love. Very run of the mill chips. Fish great. Vibe great. Glad they're here.

cKIZmA20KJ-p0XA4ne2Jjw.text: Good fish and chips. Had the lunch deal with calamari. Was worth the price, and the seafood was fresh

TEebkeF0ccc_Fu3W2akcnQ.text: YaaaaAaaAaaS fish & chips - by far one of my favorite heart attack inducing meals. My cousin Tammy T. & I ordered takeout with a side of mushy peas & pickled onion rings. We ordered the cod & it was absolutely delicious. The fish was perfectly flakey, moist, & the batter was really nice. The chips were pretty good, but you know, I'm American, so I prefer them to be extra crispy rather than chunky. The pickled onion rings were so great - I really wish this caught on in America. Pickled onion flavors for daAaAys. The mushy peas were okay, not the greatest (needed a little something extra & was more watery than mushy). Probably wouldn't order that again, but pickled onion rings, yaaaas qu333n yaas. Highly recommend if you're in the area. It's a really nice chippy; more on the hipster side & very clean. It's a little pricey, but the portions are huge. Lots of chips with your fish.

7NMydwFf1NIKrACyRhtwRQ.text: Delicious! My friends and I were looking for a good fish n chips place (typical tourists that we are) and we came across Kerbisher and Malt on yelp! It's a really nice and simple ambiance.You can choose from a variety of different fish and cook them in different ways. Cooking methods can be grilled or fried (in original breadcrumbs or matzo) and you'll get chips too! There are a few different sauces available. The fish is really moist and soft inside a crisp crust. Less oily than other places I tried for fish n chips in London.Definitely recommend this for fish n chips in London! A little pricy but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Go go go

hklZ_MCMmpzKIxQiqX9fIA.text: Average at best. Chefs know what they're doing and follow a rigid formula. If you're looking for traditional fish and chips go to a cheaper shop. You will get the better taste. Chips here are meh. Not real fish and chip chips. The fish is too crisp with too much batter.

BEiqCyqqy4udcTkORxhX9Q.text: I am from America and visited this place as a tourister. The ambience was great, and gave a nice oceany vibe as you entered. The fish and chips were pretty average and were satisfactory for someone that has nevere had them, which was me, but the price seemed a bit high considering that there are trucks outside offering the same British delicacy for half the cost. The overall experience was pretty good, but there were just a little pricey in my opinion.

3oXBtGdhXG1EMq1ugBB_Dw.text: It's ok. Decent portion but it's not super fantastic as other reviews have said. Slight disappointed.

0tWLN6fA_f1St0cly76Nng.text: If this is "the best chippy in town" then I guess I'd better just go to Poppie's.First of all, the staff stopped me quite abruptly when I rushed to the loo while entering (It was an urgent call!). While I appreciate the sentiment of not wanting strangers to just come in and piss in your pot, this is more of a restaurant or pub thing in central, and this, with all due respect, is a chippy in Shepard's Bush.A more relaxed attitude would better suit them.To the point: the fish is good, the chips depressingly mediocore. They charge for the first serving of tartare as well, which kind of annoyed me - but their tartare is one of the best I've had. Sadly it can't and shouldn't carry the weight of the drab floury chips.

SMoCwFhIWC0-TDtVam_nZw.text: Kerbisher & Malt is a very lovely fish and chip shop in Brook Green! It's definitely a little upscale compared to your average chippy shop but I'm not complaining.We ordered our cod and chips for takeaway with a side of curry sauce. Very delicious! I was surprised how amazing the curry sauce was! I'd consider coming back here just for the curry sauce. It was crowded on a Saturday night around 9pm so beware if you plan on coming around peak hours. I'll definitely be back to try the mushy peas. :)

47hUFDuYugei6OOQakH1ZA.text: Better late then never to getting around writing a Yelp review.... from Christmas 2015 in London.Stayed nearby in West Kensington, hopped on a Boris city bicycle and explored the nearby area.  Thanks to Yelp and TimeOut, I already had all the foodie spots mapped out for my regular visits to London!Kerbisher & Malts is a top notch fish & chippy shop, clean interior design, and friendly staff at the counter.  I liked the long wooden table down one of the sides, where a single patron can comfortably eat their meal.  The kitchen at K&L sets themselves apart from the rest of the contenders and pretenders for London's best fish and chips shop by delivering on high quality fillets of fish, ranging from haddock, cod, plaice, pollock, and coley.  The fillets are lightly battered, and cooked fresh to order.Accompanying the fish is a rich tartare sauce made on the premises, and the mushy peas are made in-house as well.  The double frying technique used by K&L on their chips gives it a crunchy exterior with a fluffly interior.An old fashioned chippy shop that prides itself on using fresh ingredients with no preservatives.  Worth traveling out of the way to hit up one of their few locations in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Lightly battered fish, double fried chips, made in-house mushy peas.

OOuMmX3VV9vz9yazOyoZxw.text: I decided to try this place last week, hearing about the best fish and chips in town! My friend and I ordered the "light fish and chips special", which was a good portion of deep fried Coley fish with chips and a side sauce (we chose lemon mayo). It was enough to fill me up, and I tend to have a large appetite!I can appreciate the freshness of the fish; the Coley is a thicker cut of fish so you had about two inches thick of fish for every layer of deep-fried goodness- probably healthier for you, right? The chips were of good quality. I'd say the taste was clean, well-executed. I don't think the flavors were original at all, but meddle with that and you meddle with a lot of expectations! Overall, a good portion of fish and chips served fresh for £6.

amb_4TZNt6gLelIe83XHIw.text: This is easily one of my favorite places in Hammersmith. This is a tiny fish and chip shop located on a busy street (what street isn't busy in London?) close to a great little park called Brook Green for you to be able to enjoy your food (hint, hint).It's London, so don't expect it to be cheap if you are an American traveler. The exchange rate will kill you unless you are travelling on business like I was. Go with the cod and chips. I didn't find the haddock to be that flavorful, no fault of K&M. The tartar sauce is a must. Get two or three containers and enjoy.The best part? If you have issues trying to figure out the demonstrations of the change in the UK, the cashier will help you. While I eventually figured it out, I thought it was funny to be offered such a basic service with no sarcasm behind it.

wCEvks7sry_4QfgctKO14w.text: The standard for Fish and Chips!First off a big shout out to Robyn J for the suggestion!According to the people I was working with this place is posh for fish add chips however to the tourist it cost the same as any other establishment that they would visit for their fish and chip fix... This place is well of the beaten path for most tourists since there is nothing really to see in Hammersmith but I promise if you make the trek to this place you won't be disappointed. First off they offer 4 different types of fish (I had the haddock). It's served as a massive filet SKIN OFF (as it should be in my opinion) and was light and fluffy. Add malt vinegar and a bit of their homemade tartar sauce and BAM! Winner winner fish dinner! They did not have any beer on tap BUT they had meantime lager which made a good pairing for the dinner... Hands down the best of the 4 places I had fish an chips on this trip...

photos.caption: Photo of Kerbisher & Malt - London, United Kingdom. Battered Haddock and Chips with a Meantime Ale

HwCLXMtU-73F5oHaGfDx9Q.text: The battered fish were all yummy but there were some better than others. I preferred the cod and the coley over the haddock and the pollock. The chips were pretty good too. As for the calamari, it tasted pretty good but it would've be better if it was more crispy. As for the cole slaw, I didn't really like it since it seems a bit under seasoned. As for the sauces, the sweet chili was amazing. The tartare sauce is like any other tartare sauce. The fish definitely deserve 4 stars, but the other stuff should be 3 stars. Overall, definitely worth a try.
